dcterms:creator: Keval Doshi
Yasin Yilmaz
dcterms:description: The NOLA dataset consists of videos collected from specific public areas over a week, accompanied by metadata, emphasizing the continual learning aspect of video anomaly detection without explicitly correlating video and context.
dcterms:title: NOLA dataset

dcterms:creator: Bharathkumar Ramachandra
Michael J. Jones
dcterms:description: The Street Scene dataset highlights spatial anomalies like jaywalking and wrong-way incidents, providing a new evaluation protocol for video anomaly detection.
dcterms:title: Street Scene dataset

dcterms:creator: Austin Abrams
Jim Tucek
Joshua Little
Nathan Jacobs
Robert Pless
dcterms:description: The LOST dataset provides videos from 19 cameras from the same half-hour each day over the course of a year, along with metadata, focusing on trajectory clustering and context anomalies.
dcterms:title: LOST dataset

dcterms:creator: Ivan Nikolov
Mark Philip Philipsen
Jinsong Liu
Jacob Velling Dueholm
Anders Skaarup Johansen
Kamal Nasrollahi
Thomas B. Moeslund
dcterms:description: The LTD dataset is a long-term thermal imaging dataset collected over 8 months, designed for studying concept drift with context information like weather and time.
dcterms:title: LTD dataset

dcterms:description: The WF dataset is a self-collected dataset from a public webcam looking at a baseball stadium, containing 2000 videos over three months with contextual metadata.
dcterms:title: WF dataset

dcterms:description: The Biker Day dataset is a self-collected dataset based on the Ped2 dataset, created to verify the effectiveness of context-dependent approaches in video anomaly detection.
dcterms:title: Biker Day dataset

dcterms:creator: Weixin Li
Vijay Mahadevan
Nuno Vasconcelos
dcterms:description: The UCSD Ped2 dataset is used for anomaly detection and localization in crowded scenes, focusing on pedestrian behavior.
dcterms:title: UCSD Ped2

dcterms:creator: Cewu Lu
Jianping Shi
Jiaya Jia
dcterms:description: The Avenue dataset is designed for abnormal event detection at high frame rates, focusing on pedestrian behavior in urban environments.
dcterms:title: Avenue

dcterms:creator: Wen Liu
Weixin Luo
Dongze Lian
Shenghua Gao
dcterms:description: The ShanghaiTech dataset provides a new baseline for future frame prediction in anomaly detection, focusing on various scenes.
dcterms:title: ShanghaiTech
